result.execSummary:
Michael D Bordeaux was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Michael D Bordeaux was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael D Bordeaux

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant, Michael D Bordeaux, in custody, appeared with Attorney Peter J. Morin.  Prosecuting attorney Holly D. Wood Webster.  Defendant in custody.  Janell Evan - Clerk.  1:25  AND 15CF119.  Agreement.

15CM141  -  Plead to Ct. 2 - poss controlled substance - Colfax Ord. 11-2-11   $169 forf, $67  VW fee

15CF119 - Def waives extradition

COURT:  finds waiver of extradition voluntary.  Signs form.

15CM141 - amend ct. 2 to Colfax ord - possess controlled substance 11-2-11.  Defendant pleads no contest

COURT:  finds def guilty - 15CM141 Ct. 2 - amended to Colfax ord 11-2-11.  Poss controlled substance
$169 forf and $67 VW fee.  60 DTP or pay plan
Dismiss count 2

Defendant appeared in custody with attorney Donna Burger who appeared in person.  Andrea Nodolf appeared for the State.   State requests $5000 cash bond.  Court orders $5,000 cash.  STC 4/17/15 @ 01:15 and STC 5/11/15 @ 01:15.
